title: Technology & Services
description: Explore core AWS services including compute, storage, database, and networking

questions.question: What is Amazon EC2?
options: A virtual server in the cloud providing scalable compute capacity
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides scalable virtual servers in the cloud.

questions.question: What is Amazon S3 used for?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is an object storage service offering unlimited scalability, durability, and availability.

questions.question: What is AWS Lambda?
options: A serverless compute service that runs code in response to events
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for compute time consumed.

questions.question: What is Amazon RDS?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale relational databases in the cloud.

questions.question: What is Amazon VPC?
options: A virtual private cloud enabling you to launch AWS resources in a logically isolated network
questions.explanation: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) lets you provision a logically isolated section of AWS cloud with complete control over networking.

questions.question: What is Amazon CloudFront?
options: A content delivery network (CDN) that delivers content with low latency
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a fast CDN that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs globally with low latency.

questions.question: What is Amazon DynamoDB?
options: A fully managed NoSQL database service
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fast, flexible NoSQL database service providing single-digit millisecond performance at any scale.

questions.question: What is AWS Elastic Beanstalk?
options: A PaaS for deploying and scaling web applications without managing infrastructure
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a platform service that handles deployment, capacity provisioning, load balancing, and auto-scaling.

questions.question: What is Amazon Route 53?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a scalable DNS and domain name registration service that routes users to applications.

questions.question: What is Amazon SNS?
options: A fully managed pub/sub messaging service
questions.explanation: Amazon SNS (Simple Notification Service) is a pub/sub messaging service for coordinating message delivery to subscribers.

questions.question: What is Amazon ECS?
options: A container orchestration service for running Docker containers
questions.explanation: Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service) is a highly scalable container orchestration service for Docker containers.

questions.question: What is AWS Auto Scaling?
options: A service that automatically adjusts capacity to maintain performance
questions.explanation: AWS Auto Scaling monitors applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest cost.

questions.question: Which storage class is best for data that needs to be archived for years?
questions.explanation: S3 Glacier Deep Archive is the lowest-cost storage class for long-term archive and digital preservation, with retrieval times of 12 hours.

questions.question: What is Amazon Aurora?
options: A MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database that is up to 5 times faster than MySQL and 3 times faster than PostgreSQL.

questions.question: Which service queues messages between distributed application components?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) is a message queuing service that decouples and scales microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications.

questions.question: What type of database is Amazon DynamoDB?
questions.explanation: DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database that supports both key-value and document data models.

questions.question: Which EC2 pricing option offers up to 90% discount but can be interrupted?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances let you use spare EC2 capacity at up to 90% discount, but AWS can reclaim them with a 2-minute warning.

questions.question: What is Amazon EFS used for?
options: Shared file storage that can be mounted by multiple EC2 instances
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS (Elastic File System) provides scalable file storage that can be concurrently accessed by multiple EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which service manages Kubernetes on AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) is a managed Kubernetes service that makes it easy to run Kubernetes on AWS.

questions.question: What is Amazon Redshift used for?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fast, fully managed data warehouse that makes it simple and cost-effective to analyze data using SQL and existing BI tools.

documentation:
Technology & Services

Compute Services:

  • Amazon EC2: Virtual servers in the cloud
    • Instance types: General Purpose, Compute Optimized, Memory Optimized, Storage Optimized
    • Pricing: On-Demand, Reserved, Spot, Dedicated Hosts, Savings Plans
    • Use cases: Web applications, databases, development environments
  • AWS Lambda: Serverless compute
    • Run code without managing servers
    • Pay only when code runs (per request and duration)
    • Automatic scaling
    • Use cases: APIs, data processing, automation
  • AWS Elastic Beanstalk: PaaS for deploying applications
    • Upload code and Beanstalk handles deployment
    • Supports Java, .NET, PHP, Node.js, Python, Ruby, Go, Docker
    • Automatically manages capacity, load balancing, scaling, monitoring
  • Amazon ECS/EKS: Container orchestration
    • ECS: AWS container orchestration service
    • EKS: Managed Kubernetes service
    • Run and scale containerized applications

Storage Services:

  • Amazon S3: Object storage
    • Store and retrieve any amount of data
    • 99.999999999% (11 nines) durability
    • Storage classes: Standard, Intelligent-Tiering, Glacier, Glacier Deep Archive
    • Use cases: Backups, data lakes, websites, archives
  • Amazon EBS: Block storage for EC2
    • Persistent block storage volumes
    • Types: SSD (gp3, io2) and HDD (st1, sc1)
    • Snapshots for backups
  • Amazon EFS: Elastic File System
    • Shared file storage for EC2
    • Automatically grows and shrinks
    • NFSv4 protocol
  • AWS Storage Gateway: Hybrid cloud storage
    • Connects on-premises with cloud storage
    • File, Volume, and Tape Gateway

Database Services:

  • Amazon RDS: Managed relational databases
    • Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, MariaDB
    • Automated backups, patching, scaling
    • Multi-AZ for high availability
  • Amazon Aurora: MySQL and PostgreSQL compatible
    • 5x faster than MySQL, 3x faster than PostgreSQL
    • Automatically scales storage up to 128 TB
    • Up to 15 read replicas
  • Amazon DynamoDB: NoSQL database
    • Key-value and document database
    • Single-digit millisecond performance
    • Fully managed, serverless
    • Auto scaling
  • Amazon ElastiCache: In-memory caching
    • Supports Redis and Memcached
    • Improves application performance
    • Reduces database load
  • Amazon Redshift: Data warehouse
    • Analyze data using SQL
    • Petabyte-scale
    • Fast query performance

Networking Services:

  • Amazon VPC: Virtual Private Cloud
    • Isolated network environment
    • Subnets, route tables, internet gateways
    • Security groups and Network ACLs
  • Elastic Load Balancing: Distributes traffic
    • Application Load Balancer (Layer 7)
    • Network Load Balancer (Layer 4)
    • Gateway Load Balancer
  • Amazon CloudFront: Content Delivery Network
    • Global edge locations
    • Low latency content delivery
    • Integrates with S3, EC2, ELB
  • Amazon Route 53: DNS service
    • Domain registration
    • Health checks and monitoring
    • Routing policies: Simple, Weighted, Geolocation, Failover
  • AWS Direct Connect: Dedicated network connection
    • Private connectivity between AWS and your data center
    • Reduces costs and increases bandwidth

Application Integration:

  • Amazon SQS: Message queuing service
    • Decouple and scale microservices
    • Standard and FIFO queues
  • Amazon SNS: Pub/sub messaging
    • Send messages to multiple subscribers
    • Push notifications to mobile devices
  • AWS Step Functions: Orchestrate workflows
    • Coordinate components of distributed applications
    • Visual workflow designer

Additional Key Services:

  • AWS CloudFormation: Infrastructure as Code
  • Amazon CloudWatch: Monitoring and observability
  • AWS Systems Manager: Operations management
  • AWS Trusted Advisor: Best practice recommendations
